results.title: Cockleshell Bay
results.brief_description: A series of short animated stories about Robin and Rosie Cockle who move to Cockleshell Bay with their parents to set up a guest house. Whilst there they befriend old Mr Ship and Gran Routie who help them in their play. Rated: G

results.title: Cocaine pain
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell and J Gary Mitchell Film Company
results.brief_description: This film is a documentary that takes a startling look at coke addiction. It examines how cocaine dominates the life of the users, damages their health, impairs their mental capabilities, alienates their friends and families, and consumes millions of their dollars.

results.title: Coal Power
results.brief_description: Includes “Power from the Valley”, outlining the process of brown coal mining in the La Trobe Valley and its eventual consumption in a turbine generator. (12 min) “Demolition of Yallourn Briquette Chimney” looks at the demolition of the historic briquette production plant at yallourn. Directed by Jim Hayes. (4 min) “The Timeless Force” is a history of the harnessing of energy and its eventual application by the SEC. Gives a history of the SEC’s early years. This film narrated by John Stanton. (29 min)

results.title: Coal Dust the Invisible Killer
results.brief_description: High productivity at the coalface means increased dust, a major health hazard to the miner. Using diagrams and an actual lung a doctor explains how and what diseases are caused by prolonged exposure to coal dust, and answers key questions of concern to every miner. Strong emphasis is given to suppressing dust at source through effective ventilation and water sprays, combines with statutory monitoring of dust, regular X-Ray and medical examinations. Protection today prevents pneumoconiosis tomorrow.

results.title: Coal and the nineteenth century
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Dr. Colin Russell considers the use of coal as a raw material. The six sections of the film deal with different products resulting from the decomposition of coal, looking at both the manufacturing processes and the social impact. Wherever possibl

results.title: Coaching on the job (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This instructional video aims to help employees recognise when their staff have training needs and how to respond so that these training needs are met. Five steps are identified. Step one is to determine the need for coaching. This can be done by observation or be simply asking the employee what their training needs are. The second step is to explain the task or activity that needs doing. The third step is to demonstrate the activity in question. The fourth step is to practice the task. The fifth step is to ask for feedback. With re-enactments the video shows successful and not so successful methods of coaching with suggestions of how to amend each style.

results.title: Clyde Beatty's animal thrills (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventure parade”.
Takes you inside the confines of “Clyde Beatty’s zoo” - a replica of an African jungle in Fort Lauderdale, Texas. Shows Clyde Beatty - one of “the greatest animal trainers of all time” - go toe-to-toe with lions and tigers in dangerous performances. NB: Contains disturbing footage re cruelty to animals.

results.title: Clothing: a pair of blue jeans
results.creator_credit: Mark Harris, George Kaczender and International Cinemedia Centre, Montreal
results.brief_description: Takes a pair of jeans as an item of clothing to provide basis for a lesson in economics and clothing manufacture. Uses a lyrical ballad to illustrate the concepts, following the process of making jeans from cotton fields to the boy who buys the new pair, together with a brief history of the garments.

results.title: Clothespeak
results.creator_credit: Margaret Williams, Fiz Oliver and Arbor Films
results.brief_description: Looks at established youth style groups such as Mods, Skinheads, Punks and the New Romantics. Illustrates the importance of style to such groups and aims to eliminate preconceptions about people whose appearance is out of the ordinary. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
